node.title: Genesis of the Canberra artist who just took out four ARIA awards
node.alt: Genesis Owusu performing live on ABC TV's The Set 2021
node.description: Canberra is known for many things â€” mostly politicians and public servants. But it's also home to a growing music scene, and one of its members just took out four ARIA awards.
node.content:
["Canberra is known as the city of public servants, politicians and roundabouts.", "But\u00a0the city has a new feather in its cap \u2014 home to another award-winning music star.", "Among the city's\u00a0stars are\u00a0SAFIA, Peking Duk and now \u2014 Genesis Owusu.\u00a0", "Owusu \u2014 or Kofi Owusu Ansah \u2014 was nominated for seven ARIA awards this year and last night walked away as the winner of four separate categories, including\u00a0album of the year \u2014 for his album Smiling with No Teeth,\u00a0best hip-hop release, best independent release and best cover art.", "Owusu moved to the ACT as a child from Ghana in 2000, and said he grew up surrounded by music.", "\"My mum is still the leader of her church's gospel choir. My dad just kind of loved everything that was interesting, my brother was really into a lot of rock bands when we were younger, so there was a real mish-mash of influences and sounds.\"", "", "
Genesis Owusu: Smiling with no teeth
", "Speaking to the ABC, the 23-year-old said, for his own music, he took his inspiration from everything around him, even things he hated.", "\"Yeah, if you listen to the album,\u00a0I get inspiration from absolutely everything. Even things I hate, I try and put it into a context that I like,\" he said.\u00a0", "Some of those hated\u00a0topics that feature in\u00a0Owusu's music? Racism.", "\"I used to get side-eyed a lot when I was younger for the way I dressed and the things I did.", "\"But all the people I loved and respected always stood firm, immovable, unshakeable. Because we knew the power in who we were and what we created.", "\"For all those people \u2014\u00a0goon club worldwide, eccentrics, black people \u2014\u00a0know it's not up to us to change.\"", "", "
Owusu said he used to get looks when he was younger for the way he dressed. But he says he always stayed true to himself.\u00a0(ARIA)
", "Growing up in Canberra, Owusu said he was expected to fit a cultural stereotype.\u00a0", "\"My family were the only black people I knew,\" he said.", "\"My brother went to high school\u00a0and he was the only black student in a population of like 2,000 students, I think.", "
'You should have seen me screaming'
", "Owusu's family moved\u00a0to Australia to be with their extended family, a move he said involved a lot of hard work.\u00a0", "\"My dad got a job stacking shelves at Woolies, because he came to Australia with like $200 in his pocket, and grinded\u00a0and then we got our first apartment, grinded some more ... now we're here,\" he said.", "\"Obviously, immigrant parents, when you come to a country like Australia, are hoping for your kids to become\u00a0doctors and lawyers and things like that,\u00a0so when my brother and I decided to become musicians I'm sure that's not what they had in mind.\"", "But as Owusu's profile increases, there is one fan louder than the rest.\u00a0", "His father, Elliot Ansah, told ABC Radio Canberra that while hip hop was perhaps not his genre of choice, he was \"so proud\" of his son.\u00a0", "", "
Genesis Owusu moved from Ghana to the ACT when he was young, a move which he says inspired much of his music.\u00a0(Bailey Howard)
", "Mr Ansah said listening to his son's music made him realise some of the challenges he had faced.", "\"I remember when I\u00a0first listened to No Looking Back, it was just very emotional for me because I thought he was speaking from his heart about\u00a0things that he had gone through, which\u00a0I wasn't too sure about or very aware of,\" he said.", "And Owusu's brother, Kojo Ansah \u2014 also a performer known as Citizen Kay \u2014 said the world was finally seeing what his family had witnessed for years.\u00a0", "\"We're all just so proud \u2026 he's put absolutely everything he has into this since he was 13 or 14,\" he said.", "\"There's been no kind of sense of 'maybe I should do this in case music doesn't work out'.", "As the rest of Australia discovers the Canberra-based star, the ACT is still where Owusu calls home.\u00a0"]
